## SDQ vs MAAS

Are you a psychologist or social scientist striving to compare and harmonise the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Maternal Antenatal Attachment Scale (MAAS)? If so, then Harmony is the software you have been waiting for. Harmony is developed specifically to assist researchers in examining and juxtaposing questionnaire items, even in different languages. Leveraging natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony simplifies the SDQ vs MAAS analysis process by swiftly determining a percentage match between individual items in SDQ and MAAS. The SDQ is a short behavioural screening tool about children's ages 2-17, whereas the MAAS is a 17-item questionnaire developed to gauge the attachment between mother and baby during pregnancy. The process of comparing these two scales can often be time-consuming and complex, but Harmony makes this task easier. By utilising Harmony's resources, tedious manual harmonisation can be bypassed, providing more time for detailed study and research. When dealing with subjects as sensitive as child behaviour and prenatal attachment, SDQ vs MAAS comparisons can now be more credible, efficient, and objective. Harmony lets you choose instruments from its own database, or you can upload your own instruments in PDF form. You can either select your instruments from the list or just drag and drop your PDFs into the web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app. Whether your aim is comparing granularity of adolescent behavioural assessments or co-relating a mother's architectural attachment to her child's behavioural traits, symbolic comparisons of SDQ vs MAAS is only a few clicks away with Harmony's intuitive user interface and AI-driven algorithms.

## Compare the items in SDQ and MAAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and MAAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MAAS into Harmony</a> - compare MAAS with other instruments
